glsa.title: Squid: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Squid, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: Squid is a caching proxy for the Web supporting HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, and more.

description.p: An assertion failure in processing of SSL-Bump has been found in Squid. Heap based overflow is discovered when processing SNMP requests.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request, possibly resulting in a executing of arbitrary code or Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Squid users should upgrade to the latest version:
